Description: Body sherd of large Chian Simple Animal Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior glazed streaky black; billet pattern in added red and added white between pairs of white bands; below, part of possible lotus flower in white; exterior: painted decoration consisting of sphinx (part of hair, spiral and top of wing remaining) to right.
Curator's comments: Lemos describes this sherd as belonging to the third stage of the Group of the Simple Figures. The vases in this group were probably all produced by the same hand. The leading vase from this group is the Tarentum chalice (Lemos 1991, no. 938). Flat-headed passant sphinxes with long hair falling in three separate tresses are a recurrent theme.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 131, p. 288, no. 861, pl. 119)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1025) (phase 2)
Condition: part of inside has chipped off - conservation needed
